page.title: 15LLANSTEFFAN: PUBLIC SERVICES
page.content: Llanybri and Llansteffan are administered by Dyfed County Council, Carmarthen District Council, and the local Community Council for which we are divided into 2 wards. We are in Carmarthen parliamentary constituency. A mobile policeman from Carmathen visits once a week. There is little crime: salmon poaching was the sole recent crime. But there is quite a lot of minor mischief such as vandalism by children. Police and coastguards are readily available in emergencies. Fire Service and ambulances also have to be called from Carmarthen. In a recent drowning tragedy, RAF rescue helicopters from Brawdy saved a life. Most people have telephones, but a substantial minority, especially pensioners, do not. There are adequate public call boxes - so far, but perhaps for not much longer.
